newsitem.title: SWEDEN: POLL-Swedish June c/a surplus seen at 4.8 bln Skr.
newsitem.headline: POLL-Swedish June c/a surplus seen at 4.8 bln Skr.

text.p: Swedish current account figures for June are expected to show a 4.8 billion crown surplus, a Reuter poll of 13 analysts showed on Friday.
Forecasts ranged from 4.0 billion to 6.0 billion crowns.
For the full year 1997, nine analysts expected a surplus of 48.8 billion crowns on average with forecasts in a range of 46-55 billion.
In May, the current account showed a deficit of 1.5 billion crowns and in June 1996 a surplus of 4.5 billion.
Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, will publish June public account figures at 1000 GMT on August 20.

Analysts interviewed for the poll came from Carnegie, Consensus, Den Danske Bank, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Handelsbanken, HSBC Midland, JP Morgan, Lehman, Nordbanken, Penser, S-E-Banken, UBS and Unibank.
